titleStmt.title: N. R. Wilson to Ephraim L. VanWinkle
CWG2271

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisville Ky Novr 14th 65
Hon E. L. Van Winkle
Dear Sir

Please do me the favor to send me a Commission as Notary Public A number of the lawyers here are desirous to have me appointed so that they may have proofs, depositions &c taken before me, I am Commissioner for nearly all of the States and being a notary will obviate the necessity of getting the appointment for several of these States -- I have heard nothing more from Hopper., Am anxious to get our lands all in shape & to send them on to Judge Watson as soon as possible I confidently believe that this interest will prove to be far more valuable to you than your interest in the Cumberland River Coal Co, and if we can get the lands all in marketable shape. I believe we can dispose of them within a month from the time they are set to New York for sale

Notary Public
Jefferson Co
N. R. Wilson
apptd
15 Nov/65
